item.title: A tree was blown down during the recent storm. It has damaged a private wall and it is down on a public foot path., 1st January

item.title: Bad pothole near the top of Keynsham Street close to the bookies, 31st December
item.description:
The pothole is now a few inches deep and is disintegrating even more. It has been there for months but has got noticeably worse over the last two. It is also scattering loose tarmac across the road. It is unsafe for people both on bikes and in cars, especially heading out onto a busy main road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 55 Keynsham Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual Bodged Repairs Robert Burns Ave, 31st December
item.description:
New potholes every few weeks. Some have been marked for repair but others in the same area left I assume to be repaired sometime. New ones are developing so they are future problems, why cant all faults be done at the same time? Is this policy designed to create permanent work for the repair men?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
